list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. This covers factory defects, broken parts, etc. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: I keep pressing the “ZERO” or “UNITS” button but nothing happens. What is wrong?
list.answer: Because the buttons are part of the surface of the scale, to press the button, you need to make sure you are pressing squarely over the word with the pad of your finger. If this still doesn’t work, please contact Customer Support for additional help.

list.question: Why does it take so long to zero or settle on a weight?
list.answer: Because the whole surface of the scale is a weighing mechanism, it will take a moment to register your attempt to zero. If your scale is still not responding after giving it a short amount of time to register the button press, please contact Customer Support for additional help.

list.question: My scale says "UnSt" in the weight area. What does this mean?
list.answer: This means the scale is “Unstable” and needs to settle before being used. Since the whole surface of the scale is a weighing mechanism, anything touching it will keep it from settling completely. To prevent this, place the scale on a hard, flat surface and quickly press the “ON/OFF” button; then, let it sit for a moment. This should make the message go away, and the scale ready to use.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. This covers factory defects, broken parts, etc. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: My scale keeps saying "HHHH" in the weight box. What can I do about that?
list.answer: Unfortunately, that code means your scale is broken and needs to be replaced. While we never want a defective scale to get to a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 5-year warranty with each scale. For more information about a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: My scale has gone through multiple sets of batteries in a short period of time, and I keep getting the LO error. Is this normal?
list.answer: No, your scale shouldn’t go through batteries that quickly. If that is the case, then your scale may be defective. While we never want a defective scale to get to a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 5-year warranty with each scale. For more information about a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: My scale’s buttons won’t work when I press them. I try to type in a code and numbers won’t type in. Am I doing something wrong?
list.answer: Since the buttons are part of the surface, you need to make sure you are pressing the button squarely and with the pad of your finger. Also, since there are only 2,000 food codes, to type in a code, it MUST start with a 0, 1, or 2. Any other number will not type in to start a code. If you have made sure you're following these suggestions and you are still having trouble with the buttons, please contact Customer Support for assistance.

list.question: How do I add up my totals for a meal?
list.answer: Please refer to page 8 in your owner’s manual for information on totaling meals. If you are still having trouble getting your scale to perform this function, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: What do I do if there isn’t a code for the food I’m looking for?
list.answer: If the food you’re looking for isn’t in the food code book, this scale has the ability to add up to 99 custom food codes. To create a custom food code, please refer to pages 8 and 9 in your manual.

list.question: Where does the nutritional information come from?
list.answer: The scale contains data derived directly from a U.S. Department of Agriculture database.

list.question: Why are my body composition numbers different than the ones I see at the gym, doctor, etc.?
list.answer:
Body composition analysis is an inexact science. This is true regardless of the manufacturer or method of measurement. Our scale uses BIA (bioelectric impedance analysis). What this means is that a small electrical current passes through your body to measure resistance. This number is combined in our algorithm with other factors, such as gender, age, weight, height, and activity level, to estimate body composition. Because of this, the numbers you see on your scale may vary from those you see using other measurement methods. This is completely normal.

The most important thing with body composition is to pay more attention to the trends than the day-to-day numbers. You'll have a better view of how things are really going by watching how the numbers change from month to month. Tracking on the app helps with that.

list.question: Why won’t my scale connect with my smartphone?
list.answer: This scale does not have smartphone connectivity. Take a look at our Products Page to see our scales that do offer smartphone connectivity.

list.question: My scale will sometimes show a weight that is 4 or 5 pounds heavier when I first step on it. If I step off and back on (sometimes it takes 2 or 3 tries) it will finally register my correct weight. It doesn't do this every time.
list.answer:
This can sometimes happen if you move the scale to store it or store it on its side. Our scale has a feature called “auto-on” which allows users to just step on and weigh without first calibrating the scale. If you keep your scale stored away instead of in the same place, that feature won’t work correctly. The scale calibrates itself when it turns off, so if it’s then moved into a cabinet, for example, the weight of the scale itself may not be properly accounted for, causing a swing in weight by up to 4-5 pounds.


We understand that many bathrooms are too small to keep the scale out at all times, so an easy fix for this problem is to let the scale calibrate before you weigh yourself. To do this, simply place it on a hard, flat surface, then press it awake and let it go to 0.0. Once it has zeroed out, it will be calibrated and you can step on to weigh yourself.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. The warranty covers factory defects, broken LCDs or weighing sensors, etc. This does not cover accidental damage, such as dropping, knocking into other things, or user damage of the scale.

list.question: Why does my scale show a U2, U3, etc. and not show my body composition?
list.answer:
This sounds like a user conflict, which can happen for a number of reasons – but the most common is when two people using the scale weigh within 10lbs of each other. If that’s the case, the easiest solution is to manually select yourself before weighing. This can also resolve the issue if you don’t weigh within 10lbs of the other user but are still experiencing a user conflict due to a misweigh. To manually select yourself, wake the scale up and use the arrow button to go to your profile, then press SEL and weigh.


If you still experience the user conflict or there is only one user on the scale, you can also try deleting the conflicting profile. To do this, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Next, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, let go of SEL and use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared and the conflict should be resolved.

list.question: How do I delete a profile?
list.answer: To delete a profile, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Once there, press and hold the SET button. Once U1 starts flashing, use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SET button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SET one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared.

list.question: My phone won’t connect to my Bluetooth scale. What’s wrong?
list.answer: Bluetooth is a complex and ever-changing technology. Because of this, several different things can cause problems when trying to pair your device with the scale. The best way to determine what might be causing the problem is to first take a look at the Getting Started Guide and follow the steps listed there. Also, ensure that your phone has the correct Bluetooth (Smart Bluetooth, also known as Bluetooth 4.0, or higher) to work with our scale by checking the Supported Devices List. Of course, our Customer Support department is always happy to help with any issues you have, so please do not hesitate to contact them.

list.question: My phone synced my first weigh-in, but now it won’t sync any others.
list.answer:
This can happen for a couple of different reasons. The most common is that the app isn’t open when the scale is trying to sync information. To fix this, you just need to make sure that the Weight Gurus app is open when you go to weigh. It can even be open in the background and weights will sync.

If this doesn’t fix the problem, something could have gone wrong during Bluetooth Set-up that’s now causing a problem. You can try to un-pair and then re-pair your device with the scale and see if that resolves the issue. If you are still experiencing issues even after re-pairing, don’t hesitate to let us know. Our Customer Support department is always happy to help.

This can sometimes happen if you move the scale to store it or store it on its side. Our scale has a feature called “auto-on” which allows users to just step on and weigh without first calibrating the scale. If you keep your scale stored away instead of in the same place, that feature won’t work correctly. list.question: MY SCALE WILL SOMETIMES SHOW A WEIGHT THAT IS 4 OR 5 POUNDS HEAVIER WHEN I FIRST STEP ON IT. IF I STEP OFF AND BACK ON (SOMETIMES IT TAKES 2 OR 3 TRIES) IT WILL FINALLY REGISTER MY CORRECT WEIGHT. IT DOESN'T DO THIS EVERY TIME.
Why does my blood pressure measurement fluctuate from reading to reading, even if the readings are close together?
list.answer: Individual blood pressure varies throughout the day, even from minute to minute. It is also affected by the way you fasten your cuff and your measurement position. Make sure you measure your blood pressure under the same conditions each time you take a measurement. Also, variations in the pressure can occur due to certain medicines being taken. Lastly, waiting at least 3 minutes between measurements is recommended.

list.question: Does it matter which arm I use when measuring?
list.answer: You can use either arm when measuring. However, to get the most consistent readings possible, it is suggested that you use the same arm each time you measure your blood pressure.

list.question: My monitor has gone through multiple sets of batteries in a short period of time. Is this normal?
list.answer: No, your monitor shouldn’t go through batteries like that. If that is the case, then your monitor may be defective. While we never want a defective product to get to a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 2-year warranty with each monitor. For assistance with a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: What kind of warranty does this blood pressure monitor come with?
list.answer: Each blood pressure monitor comes with a 2-year warranty that covers factory damage or defects. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: My blood pressure monitor is displaying a strange error message. What does this mean?
list.answer: If your blood pressure monitor is displaying an error message, there could be something wrong with your monitor. For a list of possible errors, refer to the chart on page 15 of your owner’s manual. This chart has solutions for the errors as well. If your error isn’t on this chart or the solution doesn’t fix the problem, please contact Customer Service for further assistance.

list.question: Why won’t my scale connect with Bluetooth?
list.answer: This scale does not have Bluetooth compatibility. It was designed as an economical alternative to Bluetooth and WiFi scales for people looking for a scale that would sync their weight data to a smartphone app but didn't want to pay for the expense of Bluetooth or WiFi. We do sell a Bluetooth model, but adding Bluetooth/WiFi technology makes the price much higher than these scales.

list.question: Why can’t I see my body fat, muscle mass, etc?
list.answer: This scale is our regular bathroom scale and only measures weight.

list.question: I can see the code on my device, but I’m having trouble scanning it.
list.answer:
If the code isn’t scanning, there’s a chance the camera isn’t set to the right zoom level (if on Android) or that it is too close to/far away from the scale’s screen (if using an iPhone/iPad).


The best and easiest way to scan the code is to stand slightly back from your scale (about a foot or so) and hold your phone at a comfortable height (usually around waist height or so). Press the SYNC button once the code comes up to show it for an extended period of time. For an Android phone, try using the zoom buttons on the camera’s screen to adjust the zoom level until the code scans. On an iPhone/iPad, try adjusting the position of the device over the scale’s screen.


Once you're at the right level, the phone will scan. Afterwards, keep your phone at that same level to make the syncing process much faster.

list.question: I can’t see the code to scan it. I just see a black screen.
list.answer: With new iOS updates, some of the permissions for apps change, including the permissions for using the camera in apps. Because of this, you need to allow the app to access the camera. To do this you need to go to Settings, then Privacy, then Camera and make sure that the Weight Gurus app appears in the list and has permission to access the camera. You can also do this by uninstalling and re-installing the app and making sure that the first time you go to sync after the re-install you allow the app access to the camera.

list.question: Why does it take so long to display?
list.answer: Because the scale auto-detects users by weight, it has a to take a moment to determine which user you are before it can finish the rest of the calculations. Your body composition is estimated using an algorithm to combine the numbers gathered from the bioimpedance analysis and your gender, height, age, and activity level to give your body composition numbers. Because of this, it takes a moment for the scale to identify you and then calculate your metrics. We’ve tried to keep the delay to a minimum, but some delay is inevitable given the technology.

list.answer: The screen is a standard screen used in a few different models, so it may have icons on the screen that the scale doesn't actually use. Due to cost restrictions, we weren’t able to design special screens for each of our scales, so some of them use the same screen without having all of the same features.

list.question: My scale’s buttons won’t work when I press them. I try to type in a code and numbers won’t type in. Am I doing something wrong?

Also, since there are only 1,999 food codes, to type in a code, it MUST start with a 0 or 1. Any other number will not type in to start a code. If you have made sure you're following these suggestions and you are still having trouble with the buttons, please contact Customer Support for assistance.

list.question: Where does the nutritional information come from?

list.question: Do these work in my Keurig brewer? Are they 2.0 compatible?
list.answer: Our c-pods work in most single-serve brewers, including Keurig, Breville, Mr. Coffee, and Cuisinart models. They also have a special ring printed around the outer edge of the lid which allows them to work in a Keurig 2.0 brewer. These cups will not work in Keurig Vue or Rivo brewers.

list.question: How long do these stay fresh after I open up the individual bags?
list.answer: Each 6-count bag comes with a little tape-down sticker that helps hold the bag closed. Our professional cuppers have tested cups across multiple days and have trouble detecting stale notes even after two weeks. To experience the freshest coffee, once you drink your first cup, you’ll have five cups left to drink within about two weeks.

list.question: Where do I store my coffee, since it’s in an open bag?
list.answer: Our carton has been designed to fit nicely in a standard cabinet. Just rip out the side perforation to pull out a bag. Once you’ve opened your first bag of coffee, we suggest you fold it shut with the provided tape-down to keep it fresh. You can then push it back into the box or just keep it near by for easy access. Some customers have found putting it in a sealed food container is a good experience for them.

list.question: How long will my coffee stay fresh in the bag?
list.answer: We’ve found through professional cupping tests that if folded shut, your coffee should be consumed within two weeks before you’ll begin noticing any staleness. With only 6 cups per bag that leaves two weeks to drink five cups.

list.question: Can the pods be stored in an open-air carousel?
list.answer: Unfortunately, you cannot store our cups in an open-air carousel like many people use for traditional plastic cups. Our cups are not individually sealed. They’re packed 6 per bag, and if they were left out, the coffee would turn stale very quickly. Although this could be perceived as a drawback of our cup-less format, the truth is, our nitrogen-flushed bags provide a fresher path to your cup at home. Our bags are 99% oxygen-free, while some single-serve cups contain up to 10% oxygen, causing the coffee to become stale as it’s in transit to your home. Freshness is all about avoiding oxygen exposure from the moment the bean is roasted until the package is opened in your home. It may take several weeks to arrive, as most products pass through different trucks and warehouses to get to your home. If your coffee isn’t free of oxygen, it’ll begin going stale the minute it’s packaged at the roaster's facility.

list.answer: To delete a profile, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Once there, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared.

list.question: Do these work in my Keurig brewer? Are they 2.0 compatible?
list.answer: Our c-pods work in most single-serve brewers, including Keurig, Breville, Mr. Coffee, and Cuisinart models. They also have a special ring printed around the outer edge of the lid which allows them to work in a Keurig 2.0 brewer. These cups will not work in Keurig Vue or Rivo brewers.

list.question: How long do these stay fresh after I open up the individual bags?
list.answer: Each 6-count bag comes with a little tape-down sticker that helps hold the bag closed. Our professional cuppers have tested cups across multiple days and have trouble detecting stale notes even after two weeks. To experience the freshest coffee, once you drink your first cup, you’ll have five cups left to drink within about two weeks.

list.question: Where do I store my coffee, since it’s in an open bag?
list.answer: Our carton has been designed to fit nicely in a standard cabinet. Just rip out the side perforation to pull out a bag. Once you’ve opened your first bag of coffee, we suggest you fold it shut with the provided tape-down to keep it fresh. You can then push it back into the box or just keep it near by for easy access. Some customers have found putting it in a sealed food container is a good experience for them.

list.question: Can the pods be stored in an open-air carousel?
list.answer: Unfortunately, you cannot store our cups in an open-air carousel like many people use for traditional plastic cups. Our cups are not individually sealed. They’re packed 6 per bag, and if they were left out, the coffee would turn stale very quickly. Although this could be perceived as a drawback of our cup-less format, the truth is, our nitrogen-flushed bags provide a fresher path to your cup at home. Our bags are 99% oxygen-free, while some single-serve cups contain up to 10% oxygen, causing the coffee to become stale as it’s in transit to your home. Freshness is all about avoiding oxygen exposure from the moment the bean is roasted until the package is opened in your home. It may take several weeks to arrive, as most products pass through different trucks and warehouses to get to your home. If your coffee isn’t free of oxygen, it’ll begin going stale the minute it’s packaged at the roaster's facility.

list.question: How long will my coffee stay fresh in the bag?

list.question: Why are my body composition numbers different than the ones I see at the gym, doctor, etc.?
list.answer:
Body composition analysis is an inexact science. This is true regardless of the manufacturer or method of measurement. Our scale uses BIA (bioelectric impedance analysis). What this means is that a small electrical current passes through your body to measure resistance. This number is combined in our algorithm with other factors, such as gender, age, weight, height and activity level, to estimate body composition. Because of this, the numbers you see on your scale may vary from those you see using other measurement methods. This is completely normal.


The most important thing with body composition is to pay more attention to the trends than the day to day numbers. You'll have a better view of how things are really going by watching how the numbers change month to month. Tracking on the App helps with that.

list.question: Why does my scale show a U2, U3, etc. and not show my body composition?
list.answer:
This sounds like a user conflict, which can happen for a number of reasons, but the most common is when two people using the scale weigh within 10lbs of each other. If that’s the case, the easiest solution is to manually select yourself before weighing. This can also resolve the issue if you don’t weigh within 10lbs of the other user but are still experiencing a user conflict due to a misweigh. To manually select yourself, wake the scale up and use the arrow button to go to your profile, then press SEL and weigh.


If you still experience the user conflict or there is only one user on the scale, you can also try deleting the conflicting profile. To do this, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Next, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, let go of SEL and use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared and the conflict should be resolved.

list.question: Why won’t my scale connect with Bluetooth?
list.answer: This scale does not have Bluetooth compatibility. It was designed as an economical alternative to Bluetooth and WiFi scales for people looking for a scale that would sync their weight data to a smartphone app but didn't want to pay the expense of Bluetooth or WiFi. We do sell a Bluetooth model, but adding Bluetooth/Wifi technology makes the price much higher than these scales.

list.question: My scale will sometimes show a weight that is 4 or 5 pounds heavier when I first step on it. If I step off and back on (sometimes it takes 2 or 3 tries) it will finally register my correct weight. It doesn't do this every time.
list.answer:
This can sometimes happen if your move the scale to store it or store it on its side. Our scale has a feature called “auto-on” which allows users to just step on and weigh without first calibrating the scale. If you keep your scale stored away instead of in the same place, that feature won’t work correctly. The scale calibrates itself when it turns off, so if it’s then moved into a cabinet for example, the weight of the scale itself may not be properly accounted for, causing a swing in weight by up to 4-5 pounds.


We understand that many bathrooms are too small to keep the scale out at all times, so an easy fix for this problem is to let the scale calibrate before you weigh yourself. To do this, simply place it on a hard flat surface, then press it awake and let it go to 0.0. Once it has zeroed out, it will be calibrated and you can step on to weigh yourself.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. The warranty covers factory defects, broken LCDs or weighing sensors, etc. This does not cover accidental damage, such as dropping, knocking into other things, or user damage of the scale.

list.question: Why can I see a Bluetooth icon on my scale’s display?
list.answer: The screen is a standard screen used in a few different models, so it may have icons on the screen that the scale doesn't actually use. Due to cost restrictions, we weren’t able to design special screens for each of our scales, so some of them use the same screen without having all of the same features.

list.question: I can see the code on my device, but I’m having trouble scanning it.
list.answer:
If the code isn’t scanning, there’s a chance the camera isn’t set to the right zoom level (if on Android) or that it is too close to/far away from the scale’s screen (if using an iPhone/iPad).


The best and easiest way to scan the code is to stand slightly back from your scale (about a foot or so) and hold your phone at a comfortable height (usually around waist height or so). Press the SYNC button once the code comes up to show it for an extended period of time. For an Android phone, try using the zoom buttons on the camera’s screen to adjust the zoom level until the code scans. On an iPhone/iPad, try adjusting the position of the device over the scale’s screen.


Once you're at the right level, the phone will scan. Afterwards, keep your phone at that same level to make the syncing process much faster.

list.question: I can’t see the code to scan it. I just see a black screen.
list.answer: With new iOS updates, some of the permissions for apps change, including the permissions for using the camera in apps. Because of this, you need to allow the app to access the camera. To do this you need to go to Settings, then Privacy, then Camera and make sure that the Weight Gurus app appears in the list and has permission to access the camera. You can also do this by uninstalling and re-installing the app and making sure that the first time you go to sync after the re-install you allow the app access to the camera.

list.question: Why does it take so long to display?
list.answer: Because the scale auto-detects users by weight, it has a to take a moment to determine which user you are before it can finish the rest of the calculations. Your body composition is estimated using an algorithm to combine the numbers gathered from the bioimpedance analysis and your gender, height, age, and activity level to give your body composition numbers. Because of this, it takes a moment for the scale to identify you and then calculate your metrics. We’ve tried to keep the delay to a minimum, but some delay is inevitable given the technology.

list.question: How do I delete a profile?
list.answer: To delete a profile, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Once there, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared.

list.question: My scale says UnSt in the weight area. What does this mean?
list.answer: This means the scale is “Unstable” and needs to settle before being used. Since the whole surface of the scale is a weighing mechanism, anything touching it will keep it from settling completely. To prevent this, place the scale on a hard, flat surface and quickly press the “ON/OFF” button. Then, let it sit for a moment. This should make the message go away, and the scale ready to use.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. This covers factory defects, broken parts, etc. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: My scale keeps saying HHHH in the weight box. What can I do about that?
list.answer: Unfortunately, that code means your scale is broken and needs to be replaced. While we never want a defective scale to get to a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 5-year warranty with each scale. For more information about a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: My scale has gone through multiple sets of batteries in a short period of time, and I keep getting the LO error. Is this normal?
list.answer: No, your scale shouldn’t go through batteries that quickly. If that is the case, then your scale may be defective. While we never want a defective scale to get to a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 5-year warranty with each scale. For more information about a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: My scale’s buttons won’t work when I press them. I try to type in a code and numbers won’t type in. Am I doing something wrong?
list.answer: Since the buttons are part of the surface, you need to make sure you are pressing the button squarely and with the pad of your finger. Also, since there are only 2,000 food codes, to type in a code, it MUST start with a 0, 1, or 2. Any other number will not type in to start a code. If you have made sure you're following these suggestions and you are still having trouble with the buttons, please contact Customer Support for assistance.

list.question: How do I add up my totals for a meal?
list.answer: Please refer to page 8 in your owner’s manual for information on totaling meals. If you are still having trouble getting your scale to perform this function, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: What do I do if there isn’t a code for the food I’m looking for?
list.answer: If the food you’re looking for isn’t in the food code book, this scale has the ability to add up to 99 custom food codes. To create a custom food code, please refer to pages 8 and 9 in your manual.

list.question: Where does the nutritional information come from?
list.answer: The scale contains data derived directly from a U.S. Department of Agriculture database.

list.question: My phone won’t connect to my Bluetooth scale. What’s wrong?
list.answer: Bluetooth is a complex and ever-changing technology. Because of this, several different things can cause problems when trying to pair your device with the scale. The best way to determine what might be causing the problem is to first take a look at the Getting Started Guide and follow the steps listed there. Also, ensure that your phone has the correct Bluetooth (Smart Bluetooth, also known as Bluetooth 4.0, or higher) to work with our scale. For Android devices, the easiest way to do this is to use our Bluetooth Smart Checker, available for free in the Play Store. For iOS devices, anything above iPhone 4s, iPod Touch 5th gen, or iPads 3rd & 4th gen, mini, or air, should work. Of course, our Customer Support department is always happy to help with any issues you have, so please do not hesitate to contact them.

list.question: My phone synced my first weigh-in, but now it won’t sync any others.
list.answer:
This can happen for a couple of different reasons. The most common is that the app isn’t open when the scale is trying to sync information. To fix this, you just need to make sure that the Weight Gurus app is open when you go to weigh.

If this doesn’t fix the problem, something could have gone wrong during Bluetooth set-up that’s now causing a problem. You can try to un-pair and then re-pair your device with the scale and see if that resolves the issue. If you are still experiencing issues even after re-pairing, don’t hesitate to let us know. Our Customer Support department is always happy to help.

list.question: Where do I store my coffee since it’s in an open bag?
list.answer: Our carton has been designed to fit nicely in a standard cabinet. Just rip out the side perforation to pull out a bag. Once you’ve opened your first bag of coffee, we suggest you fold it shut with the provided tape-down to keep it fresh. You can then push it back into the box or just keep it near by for easy access. Some customers have found putting it in a sealed food container is a good experience for them.

list.question: How long will my coffee stay fresh in the bag?
list.answer: We’ve found through professional cupping tests that if folded shut, your coffee should be consumed within two weeks before you’ll begin noticing any staleness. With only 6 cups per bag that leaves two weeks to drink five cups.

list.question: Can the pods be stored in an open air carousel?
list.answer: Unfortunately, you cannot store our cups in an open air carousel like many people use for traditional k-cups. Our cups are not individually sealed. They’re packed 6 per bag, and if they were left out, the coffee would turn stale very quickly. Although this could be perceived as a drawback of our cup-less format, the truth is, our nitrogen flushed bags provide a fresher path to your cup at home. Our bags are 99% oxygen free while some k-cups contain up to 10% oxygen, causing the coffee to become stale as it’s in transit to your home. Freshness is all about avoiding oxygen exposure from the moment the bean is roasted until the package is opened in your home. It may take several weeks to arrive as most products pass through different trucks and warehouses to get to your home. If your coffee isn’t free of oxygen, it’ll begin going stale the minute it’s packaged at the roasters facility.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. This covers factory defects, broken parts, etc. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: I keep pressing the “ZERO” or “UNITS” button but nothing happens. What is wrong?
list.answer: Because the buttons are part of the surface of the scale, to press the button, you need to make sure you are pressing squarely over the word with the pad of your finger. If this still doesn’t work, please contact Customer Support for additional help.

list.question: Why does it take so long to zero or settle on a weight?
list.answer: Because the whole surface of the scale is a weighing mechanism, it will take a moment to register your attempt to zero. If your scale is still not responding after giving it a short amount of time to register the button press, please contact Customer Support for additional help.

list.question: Why won’t my scale connect with Bluetooth?
list.answer: This scale does not have Bluetooth compatibility. It was designed as an economical alternative to Bluetooth and WiFi scales for people looking for a scale that would sync their weight data to a smartphone app but didn't want to pay the expense of Bluetooth or WiFi. We do sell a Bluetooth model, but adding Bluetooth/Wifi technology makes the price much higher than these scales.

list.question: My scale will sometimes show a weight that is 4 or 5 pounds heavier when I first step on it. If I step off and back on (sometimes it takes 2 or 3 tries) it will finally register my correct weight. It doesn't do this every time.
list.answer:
This can sometimes happen if your move the scale to store it or store it on its side. Our scale has a feature called “auto-on” which allows users to just step on and weigh without first calibrating the scale. If you keep your scale stored away instead of in the same place, that feature won’t work correctly. The scale calibrates itself when it turns off, so if it’s then moved into a cabinet for example, the weight of the scale itself may not be properly accounted for, causing a swing in weight by up to 4-5 pounds.

We understand that many bathrooms are too small to keep the scale out at all times, so an easy fix for this problem is to let the scale calibrate before you weigh yourself. To do this, simply place it on a hard flat surface, then press it awake and let it go to 0.0. Once it has zeroed out, it will be calibrated and you can step on to weigh yourself.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. The warranty covers factory defects, broken LCDs or weighing sensors, etc. This does not cover accidental damage, such as dropping, knocking into other things, or user damage of the scale.

list.question: Why can’t I see my body fat, muscle mass, etc?
list.answer: This scale is our regular bathroom scale and only measures weight.

list.question: I can see the code on my device, but I’m having trouble scanning it.
list.answer:
If the code isn’t scanning, there’s a chance the camera isn’t set to the right zoom level (if on Android) or that it is too close to/far away from the scale’s screen (if using an iPhone/iPad).


The best and easiest way to scan the code is to stand slightly back from your scale (about a foot or so) and hold your phone at a comfortable height (usually around waist height or so). Press the SYNC button once the code comes up to show it for an extended period of time. For an Android phone, try using the zoom buttons on the camera’s screen to adjust the zoom level until the code scans. On an iPhone/iPad, try adjusting the position of the device over the scale’s screen.


Once you're at the right level, the phone will scan. Afterwards, keep your phone at that same level to make the syncing process much faster.

list.question: I can’t see the code to scan it. I just see a black screen.
list.answer: With new iOS updates, some of the permissions for apps change, including the permissions for using the camera in apps. Because of this, you need to allow the app to access the camera. To do this you need to go to Settings, then Privacy, then Camera and make sure that the Weight Gurus app appears in the list and has permission to access the camera. You can also do this by uninstalling and re-installing the app and making sure that the first time you go to sync after the re-install you allow the app access to the camera.

list.question: Why are my body composition numbers different than the ones I see at the gym, doctor, etc.?
list.answer:
Body composition analysis is an inexact science. This is true regardless of the manufacturer or method of measurement. Our scale uses BIA (bioelectric impedance analysis). What this means is that a small electrical current passes through your body to measure resistance. This number is combined in our algorithm with other factors, such as gender, age, weight, height and activity level, to estimate body composition. Because of this, the numbers you see on your scale may vary from those you see using other measurement methods. This is completely normal.


The most important thing with body composition is to pay more attention to the trends than the day to day numbers. You'll have a better view of how things are really going by watching how the numbers change month to month. Tracking on the App helps with that.

list.question: Why does my scale show a U2, U3, etc. and not show my body composition?
list.answer:
This sounds like a user conflict, which can happen for a number of reasons, but the most common is when two people using the scale weigh within 10lbs of each other. If that’s the case, the easiest solution is to manually select yourself before weighing. This can also resolve the issue if you don’t weigh within 10lbs of the other user but are still experiencing a user conflict due to a misweigh. To manually select yourself, wake the scale up and use the arrow button to go to your profile, then press SEL and weigh.


If you still experience the user conflict or there is only one user on the scale, you can also try deleting the conflicting profile. To do this, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Next, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, let go of SEL and use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared and the conflict should be resolved.

list.question: Why won’t my scale connect with Bluetooth?
list.answer: This scale does not have Bluetooth compatibility. It was designed as an economical alternative to Bluetooth and WiFi scales for people looking for a scale that would sync their weight data to a smartphone app but didn't want to pay the expense of Bluetooth or WiFi. We do sell a Bluetooth model, but adding Bluetooth/Wifi technology makes the price much higher than these scales.

list.question: Why does it take so long to display?
list.answer: Because the scale auto-detects users by weight, it has a to take a moment to determine which user you are before it can finish the rest of the calculations. Your body composition is estimated using an algorithm to combine the numbers gathered from the bioimpedance analysis and your gender, height, age, and activity level to give your body composition numbers. Because of this, it takes a moment for the scale to identify you and then calculate your metrics. We’ve tried to keep the delay to a minimum, but some delay is inevitable given the technology.

list.question: My scale says UnSt in the weight area? What does this mean?
list.answer: This means the scale is “Unstable” and needs to settle before being used. Since the whole surface of the scale is a weighing mechanism, anything touching it will keep it from settling completely. To prevent this, place the scale on a hard, flat surface and quickly press the “ON/OFF” button then let it sit for a moment. This should make the message go away, and the scale ready to use.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. This covers factory defects, broken parts, etc. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: My scale keeps saying HHHH in the weight box. What can I do about that?
list.answer: Unfortunately, that code means your scale is broken and needs to be replaced. While we never want a defective scale to get a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 5-year warranty with each scale. For more information about a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: My scale has gone through multiple sets of batteries in a short period of time, and I keep getting the LO error. Is this normal?
list.answer: No, your scale shouldn’t go through batteries that quickly. If that is the case, then your scale may be defective. While we never want a defective scale to get a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 5-year warranty with each scale. For more information about a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: My scale’s buttons won’t work when I press them. I try to type in a code and numbers won’t type in. Am I doing something wrong?
list.answer: Since the buttons are part of the surface, you need to make sure you are pressing the button squarely and with the pad of your finger. Also, since there are only 2,000 food codes, to type in a code, it MUST start with a 0, 1, or 2. Any other number will not type in to start a code. If you have made sure you're following these suggestions and you are still having trouble with the buttons, please contact Customer Support for assistance.

list.question: How do I add up my totals for a meal?
list.answer: Please refer to page 8 in you owner’s manual for information on totaling meals. If you are still having trouble getting your scale to perform this function, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: What do I do if there isn’t a code for the food I’m looking for?
list.answer: If the food you’re looking for isn’t in the food code book, this scale has the ability to add up to 99 custom food codes. To create a custom food code, please refer to pages 8 and 9 in your manual.

list.question: Where does the nutritional information come from?
list.answer: The scale contains data derived directly from a U.S. Department of Agriculture Database.

list.question: Why does my blood pressure measurement fluctuate from reading to reading, even if the readings are close together?
list.answer: Individual blood pressure varies throughout the day, even from minute to minute. It is also affected by the way you fasten your cuff and your measurement position. Make sure you measure your blood pressure under the same conditions each time you take a measurement. Also, variations in the pressure can occur due to certain medicines being taken. Lastly, waiting at least 3 minutes between measurements is recommended.

list.question: Does it matter which arm I use when measuring?
list.answer: You can use either arm when measuring. However, to get the most consistent readings possible, it is suggested that you use the same arm each time you measure your blood pressure.

list.question: My monitor has gone through multiple sets of batteries in a short period of time. Is this normal?
list.answer: No, your monitor shouldn’t go through batteries like that. If that is the case, then your monitor may be defective. While we never want a defective product to get a customer, occasionally that can happen. This is why we include a 2-year warranty with each monitor. For assistance with a replacement, please contact Customer Support.

list.question: What kind of warranty does this blood pressure monitor come with?
list.answer: Each blood pressure monitor comes with a 2-year warranty that covers factory damage or defects. This does not cover accidental damage.

list.question: My blood pressure monitor is displaying a strange error message. What does this mean?
list.answer:
If your blood pressure monitor is displaying an error message, there could be something wrong with your monitor. For a list of possible errors, refer to the chart on pages 25-26 of your owner’s manual. This chart has solutions for the errors as well. If your error isn’t on this chart
or the solution doesn’t fix the problem, please contact Customer Service for further assistance.

list.question: Why are my body composition numbers different than the ones I see at the gym, doctor, etc.?
list.answer:
Body composition analysis is an inexact science. This is true regardless of the manufacturer or method of measurement. Our scale uses BIA (bioelectric impedance analysis). What this means is that a small electrical current passes through your body to measure resistance. This number is combined in our algorithm with other factors, such as gender, age, weight, height and activity level, to estimate body composition. Because of this, the numbers you see on your scale may vary from those you see using other measurement methods. This is completely normal.

The most important thing with body composition is to pay more attention to the trends than the day to day numbers. You'll have a better view of how things are really going by watching how the numbers change month to month. Tracking on the App helps with that.

list.question: Why does my scale show a U2, U3, etc and not show my body composition?
list.answer:
This sounds like a user conflict, which can happen for a number of reasons, but the most common is when two people using the scale weigh within 10lbs of each other. If that’s the case, the easiest solution is to manually select yourself before weighing. This can also resolve the issue if you don’t weigh within 10lbs of the other user but are still experiencing a user conflict due to a misweigh. To manually select yourself, wake the scale up and use the arrow button to go to your profile, then press SEL and weigh.

If you still experience the user conflict or there is only one user on the scale, you can also try deleting the conflicting profile. To do this, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Next, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, let go of SEL and use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared and the conflict should be resolved.

list.question: My phone won’t connect to my Bluetooth scale. What’s wrong?
list.answer:
Bluetooth is a complex and ever-changing technology. Because of this, several different things can cause problems when trying to pair your device with the scale. The best way to determine if what might be causing the problem is first, take a look at the Getting Started Guide and follow the steps listed there. Also, ensure that your phone has the
correct Bluetooth (Smart Bluetooth, also known as Bluetooth 4.0, or higher) to work with our scale by checking the Supported Devices List. Of course, our Customer Support department is always happy to help with any issues you have, so please do not hesitate to contact them.

list.question: My phone synced my first weigh in, but now it won’t sync any others.
list.answer:
This can happen for a couple of different reasons. The most common is that the app isn’t open when the scale is trying to sync information. To fix this, you just need to make sure that the Weight Gurus app is open when you go to weigh. It can even be open in the background and weights will sync.

If this doesn’t fix the problem, something could have gone wrong during Bluetooth Setup that’s now causing a problem. You can try to un-pair and then re-pair your device with the scale and see if that resolves the issue. If you are still experiences issues even after re-pairing, don’t hesitate to let us know. Our Customer Support department is always happy to help.

list.question: Why won’t my scale connect with Bluetooth?
list.answer:
This scale does not have Bluetooth compatibility. It was designed as an economical alternative to Bluetooth and WiFi scales for people looking for a scale that would sync their weight data to a smartphone app but didn't want to pay the expense of Bluetooth or WiFi. We do sell a Bluetooth model, but adding Bluetooth/Wifi technology makes the price
much higher than these scales.

list.question: My scale will sometimes show a weight that is 4 or 5 pounds heavier when I first step on it. If I step off and back on (sometimes it takes 2 or 3 tries) it will finally register my correct weight. It doesn't do this every time.
list.answer:
This can sometimes happen if your move the scale to store it or store it on its side. Our scale has a feature called “auto-on” which allows users to just step on and weigh without first calibrating the scale. If you keep your scale stored away instead of in the same place, that feature won’t work correctly. The scale calibrates itself when it turns off, so if
it’s then moved into a cabinet for example, the weight of the scale itself may not be properly accounted for, causing a swing in weight by up to 4-5 pounds.


We understand that many bathrooms are too small to keep the scale out at all times, so an easy fix for this problem is to let the scale calibrate before you weigh yourself. To do this, simply place it on a hard flat surface, then press it awake and let it go to 0.0. Once it has zeroed out, it will be calibrated and you can step on to weigh yourself.

list.question: What type of warranty does this scale come with?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. The warranty covers factory defects, broken LCDs or weighing sensors, etc. This does not cover accidental damage, such as dropping, knocking into other things, or user damage of the scale.

list.question: Why can I see a Bluetooth icon on my scale’s display?
list.answer: The screen is a standard screen used in a few different models, so it may have icons on the screen that the scale doesn't actually use. Due to cost restrictions, we weren’t able to design special screens for each of our scales, so some of them use the same screen without having all of the same features.

list.question: I can see the code on my device, but I’m having trouble scanning it.
list.answer:
If the code isn’t scanning, there’s a chance the camera isn’t set to the right zoom level (if on Android) or that it is too close to/far away from the scale’s screen (if using an iPhone/iPad).


The best and easiest way to scan the code is to stand slightly back from your scale (about a foot or so) and hold your phone at a comfortable height (usually around waist height or so). Press the SYNC button once the code comes up to show it for an extended period of time. For an Android phone, try using the zoom buttons on the camera’s screen to
adjust the zoom level until the code scans. On an iPhone/iPad, try adjusting the position of the device over the scale’s screen.


Once you're at the right level, the phone will scan. Afterwards, keep your phone at that same level to make the syncing process much faster.

list.question: I can’t see the code to scan it. I just see a black screen.
list.answer: With new iOS updates, some of the permissions for apps change, including the permissions for using the camera in apps. Because of this, you need to allow the app to access the camera. To do this you need to go to Settings, then Privacy, then Camera and make sure that the Weight Gurus app appears in the list and has permission to access the camera. You can also do this by uninstalling and re-installing the app and making sure that the first time you go to sync after the re-install you allow the app access to the camera.

list.question: Why does it take so long to display?
list.answer:
Because the scale auto-detects users by weight, it has a to take a moment to determine which user you are before it can finish the rest of the calculations. Your body composition is estimated using an algorithm to combine the numbers gathered from the bioimpedance analysis and your gender, height, age, and activity level to give your body composition
numbers. Because of this, it takes a moment for the scale to identify you and then calculate your metrics. We’ve tried to keep the delay to a minimum, but some delay is inevitable given the technology.

list.question: How do I delete a profile?
list.answer:
To delete a profile, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Once there, press and hold the SET button. Once U1 starts flashing, use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SET button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SET one more
time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared.

To do this you need to go to Settings, then Privacy, then Camera and make sure that the Weight Gurus app appears in the list and has permission to access the camera. You can also do this by uninstalling and re-installing the app and making sure that the first time you go to sync after the re-install you allow the app access to the camera.

list.question: Why does it take so long to display?
list.answer: Because the scale auto-detects users by weight, it has a to take a moment to determine which user you are before it can finish the rest of the calculations. Your body composition is estimated using an algorithm to combine the numbers gathered from the bioimpedance analysis and your gender, height, age, and activity level to give your body composition numbers. Because of this, it takes a moment for the scale to identify you and then calculate your metrics. We’ve tried to keep the delay to a minimum, but some delay is inevitable given the technology.

list.question: How do I delete a profile?
list.answer: To delete a profile, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Once there, press and hold the SET button. Once U1 starts flashing, use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SET button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SET one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared.

list.question: WHY WON’T MY SCALE CONNECT WITH BLUETOOTH?
list.answer: This scale does not have Bluetooth compatibility. It was designed as an economical alternative to Bluetooth and WiFi scales for people looking for a scale that would sync their weight data to a smartphone app who didn't want to pay the expense of Bluetooth or WiFi. We do sell a Bluetooth model, but adding Bluetooth/WiFi technology makes the price much higher than these scales.

list.question: MY SCALE WILL SOMETIMES SHOW A WEIGHT THAT IS 4 OR 5 POUNDS HEAVIER WHEN I FIRST STEP ON IT. IF I STEP OFF AND BACK ON (SOMETIMES IT TAKES 2 OR 3 TRIES) IT WILL FINALLY REGISTER MY CORRECT WEIGHT. IT DOESN'T DO THIS EVERY TIME.
list.answer:
This can sometimes happen if you move the scale to store it or store it on its side. Our scale has a feature called “auto-on” which allows users to just step on and weigh without first calibrating the scale. If you keep your scale stored away instead of in the same place, that feature won’t work correctly. The scale calibrates itself when it turns off, so if it’s then moved into a cabinet, for example, the weight of the scale itself may not be properly accounted for, causing a swing in weight by up to 4-5 pounds.


We understand that many bathrooms are too small to keep the scale out at all times, so an easy fix for this problem is to let the scale calibrate before you weigh yourself. To do this, simply place it on a hard, flat surface, then press it awake and let it go to 0.0. Once it has zeroed out, it will be calibrated and you can step on to weigh yourself.

list.question: WHAT TYPE OF WARRANTY DOES THIS SCALE COME WITH?
list.answer: This scale comes with a 5-year warranty. The warranty covers factory defects, broken LCD's or weighing sensors, etc. This does not cover accidental damage, such as dropping, knocking into other things, or user damage of the scale.

list.question: WHY CAN I SEE A BLUETOOTH ICON ON MY SCALE’S DISPLAY?
list.answer: The screen is a standard screen used in a few different models, so it may have icons on the screen that the scale doesn't actually use. Due to cost restrictions, we weren’t able to design special screens for each of our scales, so some of them use the same screen without having all of the same features.

list.question: I CAN SEE THE CODE ON MY DEVICE, BUT I’M HAVING TROUBLE SCANNING IT.
list.answer:
If the code isn’t scanning, there’s a chance the camera isn’t set to the right zoom level (if on Android) or that it is too close to/far away from the scale’s screen (if using an iPhone/iPad).

The best and easiest way to scan the code is to stand slightly back from your scale (about a foot or so) and hold your phone at a comfortable height (usually around waist height or so). Press the SYNC button once the code comes up to show it for an extended period of time. For an Android phone, try using the zoom buttons on the camera’s screen to adjust the zoom level until the code scans. On an iPhone/iPad, try adjusting the position of the device over the scale’s screen.

Once you're at the right level, the phone will scan. Afterwards, keep your phone at that same level to make the syncing process much faster.

list.question: WHY CAN’T I SEE MY BODY FAT, MUSCLE MASS, ETC?
list.answer: This scale is our regular bathroom scale and only measures weight.

list.question: Why are my body composition numbers different than the ones I see at the gym, doctor, etc.?
list.answer:
﻿Body composition analysis is an inexact science. This is true regardless of the manufacturer or method of measurement. Our scale uses BIA (bioelectric impedance analysis). What this means is that a small electrical current passes through your body to measure resistance. This number is combined in our algorithm with other factors, such as gender, age, weight, height, and activity level, to estimate body composition. Because of this, the numbers you see on your scale may vary from those you see using other measurement methods. This is completely normal.


The most important thing with body composition is to pay more attention to the trends than the day-to-day numbers. You'll have a better view of how things are really going by watching how the numbers change from month to month. Tracking on the app helps with that.

﻿

list.question: Why does my scale show a U2, U3, etc. and not show my body composition?
list.answer:
﻿This sounds like a user conflict, which can happen for a number of reasons, but the most common is when two people using the scale weigh within 10lbs of each other. If that’s the case, the easiest solution is to manually select yourself before weighing. This can also resolve the issue if you don’t weigh within 10lbs of the other user, but are still experiencing a user conflict due to a misweigh. To manually select yourself, wake the scale up and use the arrow button to go to your profile, then press SEL and weigh.


If you still experience the user conflict or there is only one user on the scale, you can also try deleting the conflicting profile. To do this, wake the scale up and let it settle at 0.0. Next, press and hold the SEL button. Once U1 starts flashing, let go of SEL and use the arrow button to go to the user number you want to delete; once you get there, press the SEL button again. Clr N should appear on the screen. Change the N to a Y using the arrow button and then press SEL one more time. The scale should shut off. This means the profile has been cleared and the conflict should be resolved.

﻿

list.question: I keep pressing the “ZERO” or “UNITS” button but nothing happens. What is wrong?
list.answer: Because the buttons are part of the surface of the scale, to press the button, you need to make sure you are pressing squarely over the word with the pad of your finger. If this still doesn’t work, please contact Customer Support for additional help.

list.question: Why does it take so long to zero or settle on a weight?
list.answer: Because the whole surface of the scale is a weighing mechanism, it will take a moment to register your attempt to zero. If your scale is still not responding after giving it a short amount of time to register the button press, please contact Customer Support for additional help.

list.question: My measurements aren’t syncing to my account. What’s wrong?
list.answer: It’s possible that you typed your Wi-Fi info incorrectly (Wi-Fi network name and password are case-sensitive), are too far away from your router, or selected the wrong network. Be sure to select your 2.4 GHz network if you have a dual-band router. Make sure all of your information is entered correctly and try connecting again.

list.question: What is a 2.4 GHz network and do I have one?
list.answer: Almost all current Wi-Fi routers support 2.4 GHz networks. Some modern routers have two networks, a 2.4 GHz and a 5.0 GHz band. It is important that you enter the SSID (Wi-Fi network name) for your 2.4 GHz network, and not your 5.0 GHz network.

﻿

I dropped my phone and cracked my screen protector. Can I get a replacement?
list.answer: A crack in your screen protector means it is absorbing damage that would otherwise destroy your screen. It’s normal to accumulate some chips and cracks over time. However, we understand that occasionally products are defective, and encourage you to contact one of our product specialists if this is the case.

list.question: Will it fit my phone?
list.answer: This screen protector is sized to fit iPhone models 6 and 6s.

list.question: Will it work with my current iPhone case?
list.answer: Our screen protector works with most phone cases.

list.question: Does it cover the whole screen?
list.answer: The protector covers your screen, but doesn’t extend to the edge of the phone, leaving a small gap. This space allows you to use most phone cases in conjunction with our screen protector for maximum security.

list.question: Is it easy to remove?
list.answer: Yes—the adhesive is not permanent. You can peel the protector off your phone’s screen by sliding a fingernail underneath and lifting it off your screen.

list.question: Will the screen protector change the touch screen’s sensitivity or block the front camera?
list.answer: The screen protector is made of clear tempered glass, and won’t affect how your phone functions. It is also oleophobic and hydrophobic, meaning it will resist fingerprints and water. Cutouts expose the home button, front camera, speaker, and light sensor.

list.question: What kinds of things can I use my knife to prepare?
list.answer: We designed our Chef Knives to be foundational tools for a chef at any skill level. We combined elements from both Japanese and European-style knives to optimize precision and comfort, so you can use your knife for most of the basic cuts required by any recipe.

Your knife will naturally patina over time—this is non-toxic and won’t affect the taste of your ingredients. If your knife is frequently exposed to water or not dried quickly enough after washing, it might also develop small spots of rust. You can remove rust using oxalic acid, sodium bicarbonate, or 3M microfilm sheets.
list.question: How do I remove rust and blemishes from my knife?

list.answer:
Maintaining the cutting edge of your blade requires two different steps: honing and sharpening. Honing corrects the alignment of the cutting edge, while sharpening removes material from the blade to restore the correct angle.

You can hone your knife at home with a steel however often you like. Make sure to use a steel with a higher Rockwell rating (a measure of hardness) than your knife blade. Hold the knife horizontally at a 15-20 degree angle against the steel and then draw it downward, pulling the blade from handle to tip as you do so. Repeat on the other side of the blade.

Sharpening requires professional skill and equipment, and is only necessary once a year or so. Excessive sharpening can distort your blade’s proper shape. We recommend that you send your knife out when it reaches this natural point in its life cycle. Most grocery stores will take care of it for you.
list.question: How do I keep my knife sharp?

list.answer: It’s safer for you and your knife. The metal we use will hold a sharp edge for a long time when cared for properly. Leaving your knife loose increases the chance that the blade will chip or get knocked out of shape while banging into other objects—not to mention the risk to your fingers.
list.question: Why should I store my knife in a block?

list.answer: We offer a 5-year warranty that covers any manufacturing defects. As with any kitchen item you use frequently, normal wear and tear is to be expected; that being said, we are committed to you having a great experience with our knives. If you have an issue, please contact us and we’ll make it right.
